pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:0.4: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:0.5: 13. The training rule on talking out in the open
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.2: a male relative of a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī went from his own village to Sāvatthī on some business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.4: knowing that the Buddha had prohibited standing or talking alone with a man in a concealed place, she instead stood and talked alone with that man out in the open.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.5: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.6: “How can a nun stand and talk alone with a man out in the open?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.7: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.10: “… How can a nun stand and talk alone with a man out in the open?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.11: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.12: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.13: ‘If a nun stands or talks alone with a man out in the open, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.6: not concealed by a wall, a door, a screen, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.8: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.12: just the man and the nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.14: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.16: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.17: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.18: If she stands or talks with a male spirit, a male ghost, a eunuch, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.20: if she has a companion who understands;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.21: if she is not seeking privacy;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.22: if she stands or talks thinking of something else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.24: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.25: The third training rule is finished.
